title: 4 Simple Ways to Create Reminders on iPhone and iPad

steps.title: Open the Reminders app.
steps.content: Open the Reminders app. This looks like a list with three colored bullet points. [1] X Research source The Reminders app requires iOS 13 or later, so be sure to update your iOS .

steps.title: Tap Add List.
steps.content: Tap Add List . This will be in the bottom-right corner. [2] X Research source If you want to make a quick reminder, tap the Today category below the search bar.

steps.title: Enter a List name and color.
steps.content: Enter a List name and color. This will help organize your reminders if you have more than a few. After inputting a name, select a color for you list. [3] X Research source When you're finished, tap Done in the top-right corner. If you chose Today , skip this step.

steps.title: Tap + New Reminder.
steps.content: Tap + New Reminder . This will be in the bottom-left corner. [4] X Research source If a new window doesn't open, tap the blue i next to the reminder field.

steps.title: Enter your reminder.
steps.content: Enter your reminder. Include the Title and any additional Notes .

steps.title: Add reminder details.
steps.content: Add reminder details. Tap Details underneath the Notes field to set a Date , Time , Location , and/or Priority level. If you select a Date or Time, you'll also receive the option for repeat notifications. [5] X Research source Toggle on Date and use the pop-up calendar to select a date for your reminder. Toggle on Time and scroll through the numbers to select a time for your reminder. Tap Repeat and select: Daily, Weekdays, Weekends, other, or custom. Toggle on Location to share your location. With this option, you'll be able to assign a notification based on where you are. You must have your Location Services turned on. Tap Priority and select: None, Low, Medium, or High.

steps.title: Select a list for your reminder.
steps.content: Select a list for your reminder. By default, this will be the first list you created.

steps.title: Tap Done.
steps.content: Tap Done . When a reminder has a set date and time, you'll receive a push notification before, during, or after the task (if left uncompleted). To enable push notifications , go to Settings → Notifications → Reminders → toggle on Allow Notifications and Time Sensitive Notifications .

steps.title: Enable Siri.
steps.content: Enable Siri. If your iPhone or iPad doesn't have Siri, make sure to turn it on . To enable Siri, do the following: Open the Settings app. Tap Siri & Search . Toggle on Listen for "Hey Siri" and/or Press Side Button for Siri . Tap Enable Siri .

steps.title: Activate Siri.
steps.content: Activate Siri. Depending on your settings, say, "Hey Siri" or hold the side button on your device. Siri will appear on your screen. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Ask Siri to set your reminder.
steps.content: Ask Siri to set your reminder. Be as specific as possible. Some example requests include: [7] X Research source "Remind me tomorrow at 2:00 p.m. to call Mom." "Remind me to feed the cat every day at 8:00 a.m." Location-based reminders can look like: "Remind me to check the mail when I get home." For location-based reminders, you'll need to have your address added to My Card in the Contacts app and Location Services activated.

steps.title: Confirm the reminder.
steps.content: Confirm the reminder. Siri will use the Reminders app to compile your reminders. If you don't already have a Reminders list created, you'll be asked if you want to create one. Tap Yes . The reminder will be created. You'll see a pop-up preview of the reminder. Tap Change if you need to edit the information, or tap anywhere on the screen to accept and dismiss the pop-up.

steps.title: Open the Clock app.
steps.content: Open the Clock app. This looks like a white clockface with a black background. Use this method to create a daily reminder with the iOS alarm clock .

steps.title: Tap Alarm.
steps.content: Tap Alarm . This is the second tab at the bottom of the screen.

steps.title: Tap +.
steps.content: Tap + . You can find this in the top-right corner. A new window will open.

steps.title: Select a time.
steps.content: Select a time. Use the scroll wheel to select the hour, minute, and AM/PM. If your device uses 24-hour time, you won't have to set an AM or PM option.

steps.title: Set the alarm on repeat.
steps.content: Set the alarm on repeat. Tap Repeat and select the days you want to repeat this reminder. Tap < Back when finished.

steps.title: Set a label for your reminder.
steps.content: Set a label for your reminder. This can be anything you'd like, but it's recommended to keep it short. Tap done on the keyboard when finished.

steps.title: Set a sound for your reminder.
steps.content: Set a sound for your reminder. By default, the alarm tone will be Radar . If you want to change this, tap Sound . Select from the listed ringtones, or tap Pick a song to select a song from your library. Tap Vibration to change the vibration type or create a custom one. Tap < Back when finished.

steps.title: Toggle off or on "Snooze".
steps.content: Toggle off or on "Snooze". If you want the reminder to have a snooze option, toggle it on. Otherwise, the reminder will disappear after the first alert.

steps.title: Tap Save.
steps.content: Tap Save . This will be in the top-right corner. You'll see a list of your reminders on the Alarm page. Make sure it's toggled on. If you want to delete a reminder, swipe left on the reminder and tap Delete .

steps.title: Open the Calendar app.
steps.content: Open the Calendar app. This will have the current date as the app face. [8] X Research source Use this method to add a reminder as an event in your iOS calendar.

steps.title: Tap +.
steps.content: Tap + . You can find this at the top-right corner. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Enter the reminder title.
steps.content: Enter the reminder title. Use the first field to enter a name for your reminder. [10] X Research source You can also add a location or video call in the field below.

steps.title: Set the time.
steps.content: Set the time. Tap Starts and Ends to assign a date and timeframe for your reminder. Tap the date to adjust the date, and tap the time to adjust the time. [11] X Research source You can also toggle on All-day if your reminder will be needed the entire day.

steps.title: Set the reminder on repeat.
steps.content: Set the reminder on repeat. Tap Repeat and select: Never, Every Day, Every Week, Every 2 Weeks, Every Month, Every Year, or Custom.

steps.title: Set an alert.
steps.content: Set an alert. By default, this will be set to None . Tap Alert and select when you'd like to be notified of the reminder. You can also add a second alert.

steps.title: Tap Add in the top-right corner.
steps.content: Tap Add in the top-right corner. The reminder will be added to your calendar. Depending on your settings, you'll receive a notification of the reminder. To make sure you have notifications enabled, go to Settings → Notifications → Reminders → toggle on Allow Notifications and Time Sensitive Notifications .
